prompt: Explain the difference between supervised and unsupervised learning.
response1: Supervised learning uses labeled data to train a model to predict outputs for new inputs.
response2: Unsupervised learning analyzes unlabeled data to find hidden structures or patterns.

prompt: What is overfitting in machine learning?
response1: Overfitting happens when a model memorizes the training data instead of learning general patterns.
response2: Overfitting is when the model doesnâ€™t learn enough and performs poorly.

prompt: Why is normalization important in neural networks?
response1: It ensures input features are on similar scales, improving convergence and stability.
response2: Because it keeps all the inputs exactly the same.
